metadata.og:title: Important Update: Exams, Registration and Certification Services Impacted by Job Action | SkilledTradesBC
metadata.twitter:title: Important Update: Exams, Registration and Certification Services Impacted by Job Action | SkilledTradesBC
metadata.title: Important Update: Exams, Registration and Certification Services Impacted by Job Action | SkilledTradesBC

markdown:
Skip to main content

Posted on 

Oct 01, 2025

Our invigilation partner, Service BC, and exam printing and distribution partner, BC Mail Plus, are currently participating in the ongoing BC Government Employees Union (BCGEU) job action. 

In addition, Canada Post service disruption is affecting the delivery of apprenticeship registration packages.

As a result, the following services are temporarily affected: 

Exams

  * Scheduled exams from October 7 to 31 that are not delivered in-class are cancelled. Affected candidates will be contacted directly to reschedule once exam services resume normal operations.

  * New exam bookings are currently on hold.

  * Processing times for receiving exam results may take longer than usual.




Certification Printing and Distribution 

  * Recently certified journeypersons will not receive printed certificates until the strike concludes. 

  * Journeypersons with certificates issued in B.C. after January 28, 2009 can view their certificate numbers through their Portal account. 

  * Anyone who needs to verify a certification can use the [online verification tool](/forms-registration/verify-tradespersons-certification).

  * Individuals who require proof of certification urgently for employment or exceptional circumstances can contact Customer Service. Urgent requests will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.




We are monitoring the situation as it develops and will provide further updates on November exams should the job action continue into mid-October. 

Apprenticeship Registration 

  * Apprenticeship registration packages are being held and mailed as soon as Canada Post resumes their services. In the meantime, apprentices and sponsors can find a confirmation of registration through their Portal accounts and emails. 




We recognize the inconvenience and disruption to apprentices and trade workers and appreciate your patience and understanding. We remain committed to supporting affected individuals and resuming full services as soon as circumstances allow. 

If you have any questions, please contact [Customer Service](/contact-us) for assistance. 

FAQs

**Q: I recently submitted an exam request. Will that request be processed?**

A: No, exam bookings remain suspended until the strike ends. We will contact you directly to schedule your exam once normal operations resume after the strike ends.

**Q: I was advised by my school that my blended Standard Level Exam has been waived. How will that affect my mark?**

A: We will use your in-class technical training result as the final mark for that level. 

**Q: My class wrote the blended Standard Level Exam before October 7. Will it be waived?**

A: No, exams written prior to October 7 will not be waived. Your exam will be marked and blended with your in-class technical training result as normal.

**Q: I have an exam scheduled at a Service BC office. Can I still write?**

A: All exams at Service BC offices scheduled between October 7 to 31 have been cancelled. You will be contacted directly to reschedule once normal operations resume after the strike ends. There will be no rescheduling fee.

**Q: My exam materials arrived at the Service BC office before October 7. Can I still book my exam?**

A: Service BC is not scheduling exams during the strike. You will be contacted directly to schedule once normal operations resume after the strike ends.

**Q: I am a Trade Qualifier with a challenge application expiring in October. My scheduled exam was cancelled. What will happen to my application?**

A: You will receive an automatic extension on your challenge application. You will be contacted to reschedule once normal operations resume after the strike ends. There will be no rescheduling fee.
